intro: Bartsia ciliolata, commonly known as the fringed bartsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves with ciliate margins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and usually have a pink or white color. Bartsia ciliolata is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
